statement.text: scales black with lighter margins, linear-lanceolate, 3-6 × 0.4-0.8 mm, margins entire.
Petiole reddish-brown throughout, lustrous, 1-12 (-20) cm, 1/3-1/10 length of blade;
Blade linear, 1-pinnate throughout, 5-25 (-40) × 1-2.5 (-3) cm, thick, glabrous;
Pinnae in 10-40 pairs, oblong to quadrangular, somewhat asymmetric;
Sori 1 (-3) per pinna, only on basiscopic side.

Ala., Ariz., N.C., S.C.; Mexico; West Indies in Hispaniola, Jamaica; Central America; South America to n Argentina; Africa including Madagascar, Madeira, Réunion, Tristan da Cunha; Pacific Islands in Hawaii.
Blades simple, pinnatifid, or forked (sometimes with free pinnae at base), not pinnate throughout.
Blades pinnate throughout or pinnatifid only in distal 1/3, pinnae undivided to 1–3-divided.
Blades less than 2–3 mm wide, linear, frequently forking or with 1–3 small, narrow projections.
Blades more than 10 mm wide, linear-lanceolate to lanceolate, if lobed, segments resembling adnate pinnae.
blades with apical buds or not but not rooting at tip.
Blades pinnatifid, elliptic, lanceolate, to deltate.
stem scales 0.6–1 mm wide, sparsely denticulate.
stem scales less than 0.5 mm wide, entire.
Petioles and proximal midrib darkly pigmented abaxially;
Blades 2–4-pinnate, with only largest pinnae divided to all pinnae divided.
Blades 1-pinnate, pinnae undivided (except in some individuals of A. pumilum).
Blades deltate-ovate, with 2–5 pairs of pinnae;
pinnae generally deltate-ovate to obdeltate, rarely lanceolate to narrowly elliptic;
color in living plants dull bluish green.
Blades ovatelanceolate to linear, with 5–20 pairs of pinnae;
color in living plants shiny green.
Delicate root proliferations usually present (commonly buried in mossy soil in crevices, but enabling clone formation);
Delicate root proliferations absent or rare;
Spores of different sizes and shapes, malformed (irregular in size and shape).
Medial pinnae pinnate only in proximal 1/2;
Buds at blade, pinna, and pinnule apices minute, scaly, dormant;

character.modifier: at blade , pinna , and pinnule apices
character.name: size

character.modifier: at blade , pinna , and pinnule apices
character.name: size

statement.text: foothills and mountains in e United States and s Rocky Mountains.
Petioles all pale green except at base.
e United States foothills and mountains.
blades ovate-deltate, with fine nonglandular hairs on veins.
blades mainly oblong to lanceolate, usually with glandular-hairs or narrow hairlike scales on veins or blades glabrous.
Pinnae with conspicuous basal auricles overlapping rachis;
leaves ± dimorphic, upright and tall, or spreading and short;
plants mainly on rock (epiphytic in A. auritum).
Blades mostly 4–9 cm wide, linear-lanceolate to oblong-lanceolate.
Blades mostly less than 3 cm wide, mainly linear.
pinna pairs 10–22, base with conspicuous acroscopic auricle;
Blades oblong to oblong-lanceolate, to 20 cm;
pinna pairs 4–8, base with or without small acroscopic auricle;
Sori 1 (–3), mainly confined to basiscopic side of strongly asymmetric pinnae.
Sori 4–10, on both sides of costa of nearly symmetric pinnae.
Blade apex prolonged into whiplike extension of rachis terminating in bud.
Blade apex not prolonged, terminal bud absent.
Pinnae ovate, oblong-ovate, to rhombic, mainly 4–7 mm, length 1–2 times width.
Pinnae oblong-lanceolate to oblong, mainly 6–10 mm, length 3–5 times width.
Rachises dark in proximal 1/3–2/3 or only at base.
pinna margins entire to shallowly crenate.
blades mainly less than 1 cm wide;
blades mainly more than 1 cm wide;
Pinna margins deeply lobed, especially acroscopic and distal margins, cut 1/3 or more distance from margin to costa;
Pinna margins nearly entire or shallowly crenate-dentate;
se United States to e Arizona.
auricle rudimentary or absent at pinna base;
Sori 1 (–3), mainly confined to basiscopic side of strongly asymmetric pinnae.
Blades mostly less than 3 cm wide, mainly linear.
plants mainly on rock (epiphytic in A. auritum).
blades mainly oblong to lanceolate, usually with glandular-hairs or narrow hairlike scales on veins or blades glabrous.
Blades 1-pinnate, pinnae undivided (except in some individuals of A. pumilum).
Blades pinnate throughout or pinnatifid only in distal 1/3, pinnae undivided to 1–3-divided.
